page.title: 05ECOLOGY STOCKLAND/COTLEIGH
page.content: A beautiful area threaded by narrow lanes with steep hedge banks.These present a pattern of colour throughout the year;primroses,red campion, bluebells, orchids, buttercups, jack-by-the-hedge, pennywort and foxgloves flower among others.In early summer cowparsley justifies the name Queen Anne's Lace."Wild daffodils also grow. Hedgerows contain many trees and shrubs;oak,ash,beech,hedge maple,hazel,holly,hawthorn,blackthorn, bramble and honeysuckle.Mushrooms are variable.In 1984 11 lbs of these were e picked in 20 minutes. Roe deer are in the woods,also badgers foxes,stoats,weasels,hares and rabbits.Slow worms are common but adders are rare.Bird life is prolific An odd "Seven Sleeper"(dormouse)Plenty of frogs,toads,newts, dragonflies hornets.Cider is made locally.
